title: Frontend Migration for CodeCrafter IC Platform

requirements.summary: Ensure frontend React application remains fully compatible with the new Motoko backend, updating actor integration and API calls while preserving all existing UI components and functionality
acceptanceCriteria: useActor hook correctly interfaces with the Motoko backend actor
useQueries hooks work seamlessly with Motoko backend methods
Admin login, admin dashboard, and public homepage remain functional
Contact form submission successfully sends inquiries to Motoko backend
Internet Identity authentication integration works correctly
All existing UI components (HeroSection, ServicesSection, PortfolioSection, AboutSection, ContactSection, Layout) render without errors

file_operations.description: Update the actor instantiation to work with the Motoko backend canister, ensuring the actor factory properly connects to backend/main.mo. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions before implementing to ensure proper initialization sequence.

Update all query and mutation hooks to match the Motoko backend interface defined in backend.d.ts. Ensure submitInquiry accepts all nine parameters (fullName, emailAddress, phoneNumber, companyName, websiteType, features, budget, deadline, additionalNotes) matching the backend method signature. Update user profile queries (getCallerUserProfile, saveCallerUserProfile, getUserProfile) to work with the authorization component. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions for proper error handling and query invalidation patterns.
Verify that the contact form submission correctly calls the updated useSubmitInquiry mutation with all nine required fields. Ensure proper error handling and success feedback display.

Update authentication flow to use Internet Identity instead of username/password login. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions for proper login handling, role checking, and redirect logic. Ensure non-admin users see appropriate error messaging.

Update dashboard to use authorization component's role-based access control. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions for proper admin verification, user profile management, and inquiry listing. Ensure getAllInquiries and getAllUserProfiles queries work with the Motoko backend interface.

Update authentication state handling to work with Internet Identity and the authorization component. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions for proper logout flow including clearing cached data. Ensure admin dashboard navigation only appears for authenticated admin users.

requirements.summary: Preserve all existing CodeCrafter branding elements, coral and charcoal color scheme, typography, responsive layouts, and visual design system
acceptanceCriteria: Site title remains 'CodeCrafter' in index.html
Logo text displays 'CodeCrafter' in Layout header
Hero section references 'CodeCrafter' as the agency name
About section includes CodeCrafter company story
Footer copyright displays '© 2024 CodeCrafter. All rights reserved.'
Coral and charcoal color system using OKLCH is maintained
Tailwind CSS configuration and custom color variables remain intact
All animations, transitions, and hover effects are preserved

file_operations.description: Verify that the page title remains 'CodeCrafter' and all meta tags are preserved during the migration.

Wire the generated hero background image at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1920x1080.png into the HeroSection component as the background image. Ensure 'CodeCrafter' branding text is preserved in the headline.

Verify that the Layout header displays 'CodeCrafter' logo text and footer copyright shows '© 2024 CodeCrafter. All rights reserved.' Ensure all navigation links and mobile menu functionality are preserved.
Verify that CodeCrafter company story and all statistics (150+ projects, 50+ clients, 15+ team members) are preserved. Ensure all four value cards render correctly.
Verify that all OKLCH-based coral and charcoal color custom properties are preserved in the CSS configuration. Ensure light/dark theme variables remain intact.

Verify that custom coral/charcoal color extensions using OKLCH remain in the Tailwind configuration. Ensure container settings, animations, shadows, and typography plugin configurations are preserved.

requirements.summary: Configure the project for Internet Computer deployment ensuring the application can be deployed and accessible via ic0.app domain
acceptanceCriteria: Project includes valid dfx.json configuration for Internet Computer deployment
Backend canister is properly configured with Motoko type
Frontend canister is configured to serve the React application
Application successfully deploys to Internet Computer
Deployed application is accessible via https://[canister-id].ic0.app URL
All routes (home, /login, /admin/dashboard) work in deployed environment

file_operations.description: Verify that all three routes (home, admin login at /login, admin dashboard at /admin/dashboard) are properly configured in the TanStack Router setup. Ensure the Layout wrapper with Outlet correctly renders nested routes for IC deployment environment.
Verify that QueryClient, InternetIdentityProvider, and root App component are properly configured for IC deployment. Ensure Internet Identity provider points to the correct IC environment URLs.

Verify the authorization component's usage instructions for proper Internet Identity configuration. Ensure the auth client is configured with correct derivationOrigin and identity provider URLs for IC deployment. Verify identity persistence and login state management work in the IC environment.
